cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the central Caribbean, forecast to curve northwest toward Jamaica, Cuba, the Florida Straits, and then the Southeast U.S. coastline late in the 5-day period.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida Keys, eastern Gulf Coast, and later portions of the Southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late next week, with gusts potentially approaching tropical-storm force (34–40 kt) if Elsa tracks near or just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures possible; significant surge above 3 ft is not anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain (generally 1–3 inches) possible as Elsa’s remnants pass. Current guidance keeps totals below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf could impact Delaware Bay approaches, leading to navigation restrictions or pilotage delays.
